current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the development of a fishery management
		  plan for the Gulf of Mexico red snapper, and for other
		  purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Commerce, Science, and
			 Transportation

cosponsor.#tail:

short-title.#text:

			 Conservation Act of 2013

text.#text:
Upon receipt of a certification by the Commission
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under

that the fishery management plan will properly conserve and manage Gulf
			 of Mexico red snapper consistent with this Act, the Gulf coastal States shall
			 implement all appropriate measures to manage the Gulf of Mexico red snapper
			 resource in the adjacent coastal waters in accordance with the fishery
			 management plan.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b/p:1

text.#text: Upon certification by the

header.#text:
Gulf of Mexico
			 red snapper fishery management plan

text.#text:
The Commission shall prepare and adopt a fishery
			 management plan to provide for the conservation and management of Gulf of
			 Mexico red snapper and specify the requirements necessary for Gulf coastal
			 States to be in compliance with the plan.

Not later than one year after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, the Commission shall establish standards and procedures
			 for the preparation of the fishery management plan, including standards and
			 procedures to ensure—

adequate
			 opportunity for public participation in the preparation of the fishery
			 management plan, including at least four public hearings and procedures for the
			 submittal to the Commission of written comments on the fishery management
			 plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the fishery
			 management plan may not reduce the overall quota of Gulf of Mexico red snapper
			 apportioned to commercial fishing on the date of the enactment of this Act
			 until the date that is 3 years after such date of enactment. Such plan may
			 increase such a quota based on stock assessments.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:4/ss:a/p:3/sp:B

text.#text: Except as provided in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in a manner that ensures a sustainable
			 harvest of Gulf of Mexico red snapper.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:4/ss:a/p:3/sp:A

text.#text:
In the event of a reduction in the
			 stock of Gulf of Mexico red snapper, the fishery management plan shall reduce
			 the quota described in

header.#text:
Exception in
			 case of a reduction in stock

Each Gulf coastal State shall submit to the
			 Commission management measures to ensure compliance with the conservation
			 objectives of the fishery management plan.

to revoke Federal
			 management of Gulf of Mexico red snapper, and the Gulf coastal States shall

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b/p:2

text.#text:
Upon
			 certification by the Commission that all Gulf coastal States have submitted
			 sufficient management measures described in

header.#text:
Monitoring of
			 implementation and enforcement of Gulf of Mexico red snapper fishery management
			 plan by Gulf coastal States

text.#text:
In
			 December each year, and at any other time it considers appropriate, the
			 Commission shall determine—

whether each Gulf
			 coastal State has adopted all regulatory measures to fully implement the
			 fishery management plan; and

whether the
			 enforcement of the fishery management plan by each Gulf coastal State is
			 satisfactory to maintain the long-term sustainability and abundance of Gulf of
			 Mexico red snapper.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, enforcement
			 by a Gulf coastal State shall not be considered satisfactory by the Commission
			 if, in its view, such enforcement is being carried out in such a manner that
			 the implementation of the fishery management plan within the coastal waters of
			 the Gulf coastal State is being, or will likely be, substantially and adversely
			 affected.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:5/ss:a/p:2

text.#text: For purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of each negative
			 determination made with respect to a Gulf coastal State under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:5/ss:a

text.#text:
The Commission
			 shall immediately notify the

header.#text:
Notice to
			 Secretary of Commerce of adverse determination

Gulf of Mexico
			 red snapper fishery management review

Commission
			 review and report on certification on certain State actions

text.#text:
Each Gulf coastal State that
			 manages Gulf of Mexico red snapper shall submit to the Commission a
			 certification as follows:

If Gulf of Mexico
			 red snapper is undergoing overfishing or subject to a rebuilding plan, that
			 such Gulf coastal State shall implement immediately the necessary measures to
			 end overfishing and rebuild the fishery.

That such Gulf
			 coastal State shall implement a program to provide for data collection adequate
			 to monitor the harvest of Gulf of Mexico red snapper by such Gulf coastal
			 State.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the Commission shall certify to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:6/ss:a/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
whether or not the Gulf coastal State concerned is fully carrying
			 out the matters covered by the certification.

text.#text: Upon receipt by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , it is unlawful for any person—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:6/ss:b

text.#text:
During a closure of the Gulf of Mexico
			 red snapper fishery under

to fail to return
			 to the water the Gulf of Mexico red snapper to which the closure applies that
			 are caught incidental to commercial harvest or in other recreational
			 fisheries.

header.#text:
Improved studies
			 and data collection for Gulf of Mexico red snapper

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall support the Gulf coastal States and the Commission in
			 developing and implementing a comprehensive study on Gulf of Mexico Red
			 Snapper. This study shall include, but shall not be limited to, the
			 following:

text.#text: For the purposes of carrying out this Act, the

Annual stock
			 assessments of Gulf of Mexico red snapper.

The number of
			 participants, both commercial and recreational, in the coastal waters of the
			 Gulf coastal States that harvest Gulf of Mexico red snapper.

Recommendations
			 for improved conservation and management of Gulf of Mexico red snapper.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, in
			 consultation with the Gulf coastal States and the Commission, conduct a
			 comprehensive study and analysis of the economic impacts and benefits for the
			 local, regional, and national economy of the Gulf of Mexico red snapper
			 fishery. The study shall include the following:

text.#text: The

A thorough
			 analysis of the beneficial economic impacts of industries directly related to
			 the Gulf of Mexico red snapper fishery, including, but not limited to, boat
			 sales, marina activity, boat construction and repair, fishing gear and tackle
			 sales, and other closely associated industries.

A proper economic
			 analysis of the downstream economic impacts of the Gulf of Mexico red snapper
			 fishery on the economies of the Gulf coastal States, including, but not limited
			 to, hotels, restaurants, grocery stores, related tourism, and other peripheral
			 businesses and industries.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to

, the
			 Gulf coastal States, and the Commission on a biennial basis a report on the
			 progress and findings of studies conducted under
and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:7/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and
			 shall make each report available to the public. Each report shall, to the
			 extent practicable, include recommendations on additional actions to be taken
			 to encourage the sustainable conservation and management of the Gulf of Mexico
			 red snapper fishery.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gulf of Mexico Red Snapper Conservation Act of 2013/s:7/ss:b
